result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brian D. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or combination of both

Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D. Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian D. Thomas in court with attorney Franklin R. Kirk.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State says DPA to be filed today on felony charge.  DPA for 12 months on Ct 2.  Atty Kirk agrees and waives right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Court notes information filed today but it only includes one count.  State requests one hour reset.  Back on the record, there is now a two count information filed.  DE advised of charges/maximum penalties.  Atty Kirk enters NC pleas to both counts.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty on Ct 2 and accepts DP for 12 months Ct 1.  

Ct 1:  DPA for 12 months
Ct 2:  NC
12 months probation
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $563.25.00 to be paid per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances and not to possess any controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription
Random urinalysis
No bars/taverns/liquor stores or businesses where paraphernalia is sold
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or education
Treatment and any other conditions per agent
DE to report to P&P today
Return date on November 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brian D. Thomas in court with attorney Franklin R. Kirk.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer has been extended.  Request reset to further discuss.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Return date on October 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brian D. Thomas appeared by video means from LEC.  Atty. Franklin Kirk appears in court for defendant.  Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2000.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances; NO poss. of controlled substances w/o valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
